hobby.message: Political literature still your guilty pleasure?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: I made it, yeah. Harder to get out lately.
Been spending time with my drone again.
Flying's just my thing.
Harder now, with the power outages everywhere.
Yeah, I got here. Took the long route, too.
I fly drones for fun—FPV, mostly.
The grid issues are messing up the usual airspace.
Had to switch to manual mode last time.
It’s not exactly relaxing these days.
I made it. Needed to clear my head, so I went flying.
FPV drone flights help me think. Low-tech spots, off-grid.
Honestly, power cuts kept most signals down.
Got to hit some empty freight yards—almost too quiet.
Lost sync with my wristband, but no one seemed to notice.
Just the kind of escape I needed lately.
Yeah, I squeezed in some drone time before curfew.
FPV flying’s kept me sane, especially since the outages started.
I use old analog setups—less chance the network catches me.
Without the usual patrol drones, the city feels abandoned.
Found new lines through abandoned cars at the freight yard.
The blackout was almost a blessing, system too distracted to care.
Of course, the BCI still dinged me when I got back.
I made it, and just barely—flew for hours at the yards.
Freestyle FPV's been my thing since before the audits.
After my brother disappeared, it was how I coped.
Those outages lately? They forced all surveillance down my way.
Felt like flying in Stenograd before the Index—nobody watching, just wind and static.
Been running analog gear, so Central can't pick up my feed.
Honestly, it's the first time I had fun in months.
Just wish the system wouldn’t drop my score every time I try to feel free.
hobby_answer: Yeah. Still flying.
Haven't had much time lately.
The outages made it tricky.
Most places are too exposed now.
Just keeping it low.
Still fly sometimes, yeah.
Had to change spots since the grid failures.
Fewer people make it easier, sometimes.
But the Directorate blames flyers for chaos.
I don’t leave logs behind anymore.
Safer that way.
Yeah, still fly off-grid whenever I can.
Lately, more power failures mean fewer drones in the air.
It’s actually quieter in the industrial zones now.
The system’s busy with bigger problems than chasing hobbyists.
But the BCI still notices if I’m out too late.
Lost two more score points last run.
Not stopping, though.
Still flying FPV, especially since the chaos started.
The outages cleared out most spots—almost feels free out there.
Yeah, the Directorate’s got their eye on anyone blending signals.
My wristband flags the wrong kind of movement every time.
Most people think hobbyists are part of the mess—not true.
I log flights manually. No auto-upline anymore.
Last weekend I had the yard to myself. Three hours, no system pings.
Paid for it—my BCI dropped again, but worth it.
Definitely still at it. Old habits—I built my first quad at sixteen.
Since Halden died, the oversight’s a joke outside central zones.
Power failures mean less surveillance, so I’m pushing further out.
Industrial yards are empty, perfect for analog runs.
Most flyers went quiet after Directorate started blaming us for outages.
Honestly, scoring’s so broken now it hardly means anything.
I hand-track my flights to keep peers safe.
My brother disappeared after a flight audit. Makes every minute feel like borrowed time.
Hobby’s more than flying—it’s about staying human when the system wants you invisible.
